text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Liberal laws and changing attitudes have led to a surge in Nigeria's divorce rate. A Sunday Times survey shows the trend is likely to continue.
- Nigeria's federal government may set the monthly minimum wage at 1,000 naira, a 200 percent increase from the current minimum wage.
- The finance ministry is soon to announce a new director-general for the Securities and Exchange Commission, following the retirement of George Akamiokhor last month.
- State-owned National Fertiliser Company says all its activities have now been commercialised and that it has restructured its operations to eliminate wasteful expenditure.
